body:
Hi @AriPerkkio, thanks for the issue!

You should use [@typescript-eslint/no-useless-constructor](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/blob/master/packages/eslint-plugin/docs/rules/no-useless-constructor.md) rule instead of the core `no-useless-constructor` rule:

```json
{  
  "no-useless-constructor": "off",
  "@typescript-eslint/no-useless-constructor": ["error"]
}
```

The `@typescript-eslint/no-useless-constructor` should work.

This is not really blocking my development or anything. I'm just running a tool I've created and checking stability of well-known ESLint plugins. I'm reporting all findings to plugin developers, if possible.

How about that JS case with Flow typings, https://github.com/FormidableLabs/react-music/blob/HEAD/interfaces/tunajs.js#L13?

> I'm just running a tool I've created and checking stability of well-known ESLint plugins. I'm reporting all findings to plugin developers, if possible.

Thanks for doing that! [eslint-remote-tester](https://github.com/AriPerkkio/eslint-remote-tester) looks awesome.

> How about that JS case with Flow typings, https://github.com/FormidableLabs/react-music/blob/HEAD/interfaces/tunajs.js#L13?

Did you run the rule with `@typescript-eslint/parser`? It seems they're using `babel-eslint`, and this error doesn't happen with babel because it generates a different AST (I tried with several `babel-eslint` and `@babel/eslint-parser` versions).

> Did you run the rule with `@typescript-eslint/parser`? It seems they're using `babel-eslint`

This was indeed spotted with `@typescript-eslint/parser`. With `babel-eslint` there are no errors.

It seems that turning off this rule is common when using `@typescript-eslint/parser`, e.g. in [react-app config](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-react-app/index.js#L89-L90). As this rule is not included in the `eslint:recommended` I don't think many will run into this.

I think it is safe to close this issue without taking action. But on the other hand - this was the only rule of `eslint:all` which crashed when linting 164 repositories. Every other rule seemed stable. Having perfect score would be awesome. ðŸ’¯

issue.title: Fix: no-useless-constructor (#13830)

labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age

labels.name: 3rd party plugin
labels.description: This is an issue related to a 3rd party plugin, config, or parser

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://js.foundation/community/code-of-conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

[ ] Documentation update
[x] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofixing to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->
Fixes #13830 
- Do not crash on parsers which do not require class constructor to have a body

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Old implementation relies that class constructor has body. Added a check to verify this before accessing the object in order to prevent null pointer. 

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

As discussed on the ticket, it seems to be common practice to disable this rule when using typescript-parser. However I would rather avoid linter crash when this rule is enabled with specific parsers. Currently users will not see other erroneous cases in the same file due to linter crash.

issue.title: Report crashing rules to ESLint community plugins

repository.name: eslint-remote-tester
repository.description: CLI tool for testing given ESlint rules against multiple repositories at once.

issue.body:
In order to have some long term statistics let's keep a list of findings.

- `no-useless-constructor: Cannot read property 'body' of null` https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/13830
- `Bug: eslint-plugin-react-hooks: Cannot read property 'type' of undefined at analyzePropertyChain` https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/20204
- Unreleased: `Add new rule "react/no-referential-type-default-prop"` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/pull/2848
- `import-style: Cannot read property 'type' of undefined` https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn/issues/902
- `prefer-query-selector: Cannot read property 'type' of undefined` https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn/issues/903
- `prefer-to-have-style: Cannot read property 'range' of undefined` https://github.com/testing-library/eslint-plugin-jest-dom/issues/97
- `[method-signature-style] Cannot read property 'typeAnnotation' of undefined #2834` https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/2834
- `prevent-abbreviations: Fix objects must not be overlapped in a report.` https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn/issues/912
- `jsx-no-script-url: Cannot read property 'type' of null` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2871
- `no-typos: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2870
- `jsx-max-depth: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2869
- `useSelector-prefer-selectors: Cannot read property 'type' of undefined` https://github.com/DianaSuvorova/eslint-plugin-react-redux/issues/59
- `no-unused-prop-types: Cannot read property 'name' of null` https://github.com/DianaSuvorova/eslint-plugin-react-redux/issues/58
- `no-force: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined` https://github.com/cypress-io/eslint-plugin-cypress/issues/71
- `no-unnecessary-waiting: Cannot read property 'undefined' of undefined` https://github.com/cypress-io/eslint-plugin-cypress/issues/72
- `createBannedAttributeRule: Cannot destructure property 'object' of 'undefined' or 'null'` https://github.com/testing-library/eslint-plugin-jest-dom/issues/127
- `jsx-wrap-multilines: RangeError: Invalid count value` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2875
- `prefer-default-export: Cannot read property 'type' of null` https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1965
- `prefer-wait-for: Cannot read property 'arguments' of null` https://github.com/testing-library/eslint-plugin-testing-library/issues/272
- `no-manual-cleanup: Cannot read property 'match' of undefined` https://github.com/testing-library/eslint-plugin-testing-library/issues/273
- `mapStateToProps-prefer-hoisted: Cannot read property 'type' of null` https://github.com/DianaSuvorova/eslint-plugin-react-redux/issues/63
- `no-unknown-property: allowedTags.indexOf is not a function` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2879
- `jsx-max-depth: Maximum call stack size exceeded` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2880
- `[comma-spacing] Cannot read property 'range' of undefined` https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/2906
- `jsx-no-constructed-context-values: Cannot read property 'set' of undefined` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2894
- `jsx-no-constructed-context-values: Cannot read property 'type' of null` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/2895
- `role-supports-aria-props: Cannot read property 'expression' of undefined` https://github.com/jsx-eslint/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/issues/770
- `no-dupe-characters-character-class: Incompatible flags: The i flag is forbidden to create a literal but required by the options.` https://github.com/ota-meshi/eslint-plugin-regexp/issues/189
- `[prefer-readonly-parameter-types] Maximum call stack size exceeded` https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/3396
- `[prefer-readonly-parameter-types] Cannot read property 'flags' of undefined` https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/3405
- `no-deprecated: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/3016
- `prefer-user-event: Cannot read property 'value' of undefined` https://github.com/testing-library/eslint-plugin-testing-library/issues/405
- `no-typos: TypeError: only function nodes are expected` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/3036
- `no-html-link-for-pages: TypeError [ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE]: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received undefined` https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/28030
- `no-namespace: TypeError: Cannot read property 'indexOf' of null` https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/3082
- `[prefer-regexp-exec] Cannot read property 'type' of undefined` https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/3941
- `no-legacy-features: Error while loading rule 'regexp/no-legacy-features': Debug Failure` https://github.com/ota-meshi/eslint-plugin-regexp/issues/378
- Bug: `no-restricted-exports`: Cannot read property 'name' of null https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/15384
